intro: Cracca tenuissima, commonly known as the slender cracca, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its delicate appearance and aromatic foliage, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
